title.narrative: Provide critical support to people affected by the crisis: Targeted Supplementary Feeding for treatment of moderate acute malnutrition in children under 5

description.narrative: The main objective of this project is to treat almost 10,000 children with moderate acute malnutrition in four regions of the Central African Republic, including 3,800 displaced children. WFP and its partners will use CERF funds to train health personnel and provide plumpy nut, screen children for malnutrition and provide information to communities on hygiene and good nutrition. One goal is to increase the recovery rate from 50 to 75 per cent for malnourished children who are treated. The project will be implemented within three months.

owner-org.narrative: UN OCHA Central Emergency Response Fund (CERF)

organisation.narrative: UN Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA)

mailing-address.narrative: United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA), Central Emergency Response Fund (CERF), 2 United Nations Plaza (DC2), East 44th street (13th floor), United Nations, New York, USA

condition.narrative: CERF funding is based on an agreed proposal, including specific planned outcomes and outputs.
